references.paper_title: Pick-a-Pic: An open dataset of user preferences for text-to-image generation
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it introduces a dataset used for evaluating the performance of the proposed method. The cost of creating this dataset ($50K) is cited as a major motivation for the proposed method's focus on cost-effectiveness.

references.paper_title: Deep reinforcement learning from human preferences
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the concepts of reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) which serves as a relevant comparison and contrast for the DPO approach adopted in the proposed method. RLHF's limitations in terms of cost and scalability are discussed, justifying the need for the proposed approach.

references.paper_title: Direct preference optimization: Your language model is secretly a reward model
references.reason: This paper introduces the Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) method, which is central to the proposed approach. DPO is presented as a more efficient alternative to traditional reinforcement learning and is the core of the proposed RankDPO method.

references.paper_title: Diffusion model alignment using direct preference optimization
references.reason: This paper applies DPO to diffusion models and provides relevant baseline results for comparison with the proposed method. It highlights similar goals and challenges in aligning models with human preferences.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it discusses the foundation of Stable Diffusion models, which are used in the experiments to generate and compare the results of different methods. This makes it a very important contribution to the field that is being used as the base for the improved approaches.

references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper is important because it presents a state-of-the-art text-to-image model (SD3-Medium) used in experiments. This paper showcases the latest advancements in text-to-image generation which is one of the models used to compare the results and validate the proposed method.

references.paper_title: SDXL: Improving latent diffusion models for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces the SDXL model which is the primary text-to-image model used in experiments and therefore is crucial to the results and comparison.

references.paper_title: Learning to rank with nonsmooth cost functions
references.reason: This paper is relevant because it introduces the concept of learning-to-rank which is applied in RankDPO using the DCG weighting scheme. This shows the theoretical background for the method used for improving the alignment with preference ranking.

references.paper_title: The lambdaloss framework for ranking metric optimization
references.reason: This paper is relevant because it presents the LambdaLoss framework, which is the inspiration for the RankDPO loss function. The details of the LambdaLoss are important for understanding the theoretical grounding for the loss used in RankDPO.

references.paper_title: A theoretical analysis of ndcg type ranking measures
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical foundation for the use of ranking metrics (NDCG) in the context of information retrieval, relevant for the justification of using the DCG weighting scheme within the RankDPO method.

references.paper_title: Rank analysis of incomplete block designs: I. the method of paired comparisons
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the concept of pairwise preferences, which forms the basis for understanding the limitations of traditional DPO and motivations behind the novel RankDPO approach.

references.paper_title: Davidsonian scene graph: Improving reliability in fine-grained evaluation for text-image generation
references.reason: This paper introduces the Davidsonian Scene Graph, a benchmark dataset used in the experiments section to evaluate the prompt-following and visual quality of the generated images. Understanding this benchmark and metrics is essential for interpreting the experimental results.

references.paper_title: T2I-Compbench: A comprehensive benchmark for open-world compositional text-to-image generation
references.reason: This paper introduces T2I-Compbench dataset which is one of the important benchmarks used for evaluating the proposed method and comparing the results with existing methods and models.

references.paper_title: Geneval: An object-focused framework for evaluating text-to-image alignment
references.reason: This paper introduces the GenEval dataset, which is used in the experiments as one of the crucial benchmarks. It provides a detailed evaluation of the proposed method and shows results with respect to existing models and methods.

references.paper_title: Training a helpful and harmless assistant with reinforcement learning from human feedback
references.reason: This paper presents another approach to training text-to-image models from human feedback that can be compared and contrasted with the proposed method. This paper highlights the importance of training and providing the context for the proposed approach.

references.paper_title: Q-Align: Teaching LLMs for visual scoring via discrete text-defined levels
references.reason: This paper presents the Q-Align evaluation metric which is one of the important metrics used in the experiments to evaluate and compare the visual quality aspect of the generated images. Using this metric helps in obtaining more complete evaluation and is important for the results.

references.paper_title: Comat: Aligning text-to-image diffusion model with image-to-text concept matching
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept matching which is one of the techniques used in the experiments for aligning the generated images with prompts. This is relevant for the proposed method as well and provides a comparative analysis.

references.paper_title: Evaluating text-to-visual generation with image-to-text generation
references.reason: This paper is relevant as it provides a detailed discussion of the evaluation metrics and techniques that are used in the experimental section. This is an important contribution as the techniques used in this paper are relevant for the experiments in the proposed paper.

references.paper_title: Constitutional AI: Harmlessness from AI feedback
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the concept of using AI feedback for aligning models, relevant to the use of synthetic preferences in the proposed method. This paper provides justification and theoretical support for the use of synthetic data.

references.paper_title: Margin-aware preference optimization for aligning diffusion models without reference
references.reason: This paper is relevant as it presents another preference optimization method, Margin-aware Preference Optimization, which can be compared and contrasted with the proposed RankDPO method. This provides context and helps evaluate the proposed method relative to existing techniques.
